thread.title: Mum ran over and killed her two-year-old daughter in tragic school run accident
thread.title_full: Mum ran over and killed her two-year-old daughter in tragic school run accident

author: Martin Fricker
title: Mum ran over and killed her two-year-old daughter in tragic school run accident
text:
The inquest was held at Reading Town Hall (Photo: Google Maps) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A mum ran over and killed her toddler daughter after forgetting to put her in the family car as she went on the school run, an inquest heard. 
Amanda Qi reversed into tragic two-year-old Karen in her Toyota Prius on the driveway of their home. 
She put son William into his seat but was distracted from getting her daughter in because she was throwing away a banana skin. 
The inquest in Slough was told Amanda began reversing before she felt a “bump” and realised Karen was not in the car. 
She rushed outside and found her daughter, who she called Qi-Qi, was neither conscious nor breathing. 
“I made sure William had his seatbelt on and then I reversed and felt a strange bump,” Amanda told the inquest. 
“I realised Qi-Qi was not in the car. I realised she was not there. I turned the engine off and went to the back of the car. 
“She was lying on the floor next to the rear passenger side wheel. She was not breathing or conscious. 
“I took out my phone to call 999 and other people came to help at that point. 
Amanda said she had been running late when the tragedy happened in Wraysbury, Berks, last November. 
“We were running late as usual,” she said. “The last time I recall seeing her was at the front door of the house. 
“I rushed, I thought she was already in. I thought I had already fastened her into the seat. 
“I did not reverse back very far. The bump I felt was very slight, it did feel I had run something over.” 
The hearing was told little Karen suffered a brain haemorrhage and fractured skull and died at the scene. 
Emma Jones, assistant coroner for Berkshire, record a conclusion of accidental death. Like us on Facebook
